The '''Bay of Eldamar''' was a wide bay in the coasts of [[Aman]] on the western shores of the [[Belegaer|Great Sea]]. It was here that the island of [[Tol Eressëa]] would finally come to be anchored.

== History ==
For many years the [[Teleri]] dwelled on Tol Eressëa. Eventually, [[Ossë]] guided them across the windless surface of the Bay to the shores of Aman, where they would come to dwell in the haven of [[Alqualondë]].<ref>{{S|Princes}}</ref>

The Bay of Eldamar was visited long afterwards by the mortal [[Eärendil]] the Mariner during the [[War of Wrath]]. He anchored his ship [[Vingilot]] in the Bay while he entered the Blessed Realm on his embassy to the [[Valar|Powers]] who dwelled there.<ref>{{S|Earendil}}</ref>

==Other versions of the legendarium==
The Bay of Eldamar is referenced in Tolkien's ''[[Roverandom]]''. In the story, written down in [[1927]], the great whale [[Uin]] takes the enchanted dog [[Rover]]andom (formerly known as Rover) on adventures through the seas. Uin takes Roverandom through the [[Shadowy Seas]] to the "Bay of Fairyland" beyond the [[Enchanted Isles|Magic Isles]] where Rover saw the [[Pelóri|Mountains of Elvenhome]] and the light of Faery. Roverandom thought he could see the white glint of [[Tirion|a city of Elves on a green hill far away in the distance]].<ref name="Roverandom">{{HM|R}}, pp. 73-4</ref>
